attributes.action: Impeach Tony Blair for his role in the 2003 invasion of Iraq
attributes.background: Referencing the findings documented in Sir John Chilcot's Iraq Inquiry report, we call on parliament to impeach Tony Blair for his actions as Prime Minister in relation to the 2003 invasion of Iraq. The evidence shows that Tony Blair deceived parliament to gain support for a legally unjustified war.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept a petition calling for impeachment because this procedure is now considered obsolete. It is not therefore clear what action could be taken on this petition. 
 
This note explains the history of impeachment and the current position: 

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-7612
